prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'Dear love, for nothing less than thee'

responses.text:

The stars would dare their light resign,
The moon forsake her silver sea,

On winds that whisper only you;

Is love as endless as the blue.

Your name is music in my soul;
For nothing less than thee, always,
Could ever make my spirit whole.

Would I surrender dreams or time,
Or trade the gentle melody
Of hope for reason or for rhyme.
You are the fire within my chest,
The calm that soothes the stormy sea;
For in your arms I find my rest—
Dear love, for nothing less than thee.

No riches, crowns, or fleeting fame
Could tempt my heart to ever stray;

To give to you, and you I’ll stay.

Or barter with eternity

The world may offer wealth and praise,
Its fleeting treasures at my feet;

Do I find joy that feels complete.

So let the seasons come and go,
And let the ages rise and fall;
For nothing less than you, I know,
Could ever truly be my all.

Dear love, for nothing less than thee
Would I endure the winter’s chill,
Or brave the wild, uncharted sea
With heart and hope and stubborn will.
The world may tempt with golden gleam,
With promises of fame or power,
Yet you alone are every dream,
My sun, my star, my blooming flower.

So let the years drift softly by,

My soul’s one truth will never die:
Dear love, for nothing less than thee.

But all my longing, all my taste,
Is found in you and will not stray.

So here I stand, my heart revealed,
With every hope and fear confessed;
For nothing less than thee can heal
The restless ache within my chest.
